title: Check that broadcast and multicast packets are counted properly

content.raw:
Something to test with the bytecounter: the use of broadcast and multicast addresses. 

E.g., for broadcast: if the OCU sends a packet to 10.255.255.255, will it be delivered to fc1 and/or fc2, but not be counted because the destination address doesn't match?  Same question in the other direction: can fc1 and/or fc2 get a broadcast packet to the OCU without being counted?

Same questions for multicast.

It might take some manipulation of the routing tables on the OCU and/or the field computers to get those packets delivered across the router, and I'm not sure that it's possible.  But teams have control of those machines, so if it is possible, we need to catch it.
